item.title: Harvard i-lab | Startup Secrets: Turning Products into Companies - Harvard Innovation Labs
item.description:
You've figured out your value prop, you've got a great product under development. Now what? How can you develop a roadmap to build a company? VCs often qualify deals as being a "feature" a "product" or a "company." Which do you have and how will you get where you want to go? During this session we'll discuss how to think about designing your product as a foundational element of your business. Think beyond UX and Architecture to Whole Product, Ecosystems, and Strategic partners. Formulate how to design your go to market strategy and business model into your product with a modular architecture, distinctive packaging and a frictionless approach.
Learn more about the Harvard Innovation Lab at http://i-lab.harvard.edu/ and follow us on Twitter at http://twitter.com/innovationlab and like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/harvardinnovationlab
item.itunes:subtitle: by Harvard Innovation Labs published on Wednesday, June 12 2013 at 03:41:35

item.title: Itâ€™s Time to Fact-Check Appleâ€¦ - Snazzy Labs
item.description:
Apple announced a new â€œColor Balanceâ€ feature for Apple TV in their Spring Loaded keynote. Does it work? How does it fair against professional calibration? What is color, anyways?
Pre-order the new Apple TV 4K - https://amzn.to/3euE39Y Purchase an Apple TV 4K (last gen) - https://amzn.to/3h4Cy3U Purchase a X-Rite i1Display Pro Plus (HDR capable) - https://amzn.to/3xTAWjf Purchase Calman - https://www.portrait.com/calman-calibration-software/
Check out the latest episode of my podcast Flashback - https://relay.fm/flashback Follow me on Twitter - https://twitter.com/snazzyq Follow me on Instagram - https://instagram.com/snazzyq
The new Apple TV 4K doesnâ€™t just sport a new remote, it has a new Color Balance feature for color calibration. In a bit of a surprising move, Apple brought this feature to any Apple TV running iOS 14.5 or later. In essence, it uses the Face ID array on your iPhone to measure and analyze the color output of your TV against the baseline targets established by filmmakers and the industry: Rec.709 and Rec.2020 for HDR. The AppleTV will then modify its color output over HDMI to make your display more â€œcolor accurate.â€ The question is: does it really work? Is it better than just calibrating yourself? How does it compare to professional calibration? And is color really the biggest issue that your TV has? Find out this and moreâ€”as well as how color, luminance, and chromaticity/locus charts workâ€“in this new Snazzy Labs video!
item.itunes:subtitle: by Snazzy Labs published on Friday, May 7 2021 at 20:20:52

item.title: Easy Way To Market Yourself and Why You Should Do It - Tell Your Story Part 1 - The Futur
item.description:
How to market yourself to your audience? How can you establish yourself as a thought leader but still makes people like you? What is the best marketing strategy that you can use in long term?
All of that can be answered in just one phrase: Tell your story. But how and why you should tell your story. In this first episode, Chris will show you why telling your story is one of the best way you can do to make people know you, like you and trust you

item.title: Reinvent Yourself (2021)â€“ Obstacles Are Opportunities In Disguise - The Futur
item.description:
How come some people are stuck and other are quick to change? How does someone get over obstacles? How do you bring all of your interests together to use as an advantage? How do you pivot?
In this talk from Graphika Manila 2021 youâ€™ll hear Chris tell his story of how we was able to go from graphic design, motion design, and everything in between to going on youtube and teaching millions. He also shares how you can overcome obstacles and use them to your advantage.

item.title: NASA Reestablishes Contact with the Voyager, Almost 12 Billion Miles from Earth! - TheSimplySpace
item.description:
44 years: That's how long it's been since the Voyager 2 space probe left our blue home planet to subsequently gain new insights into our galactic neighborhood in the endless expanses of space. During this time, NASA's unmanned spacecraft penetrated an incredible 12 billion miles into space and passed numerous planets of our solar system during its flight. While Voyager 2 has regularly sent important data to Earth over the past four and a half decades, the connection to the world-famous probe was severed for many months in March of last year. We will now reveal the reasons for this and how the experts of the renowned space agency finally managed to restore the signal to Voyager 2. However, before we get into this topic, we would like to take a look at the spacecraftâ€™s history together with you. In today's video, youâ€™ll find out which celestial bodies the probe has already visited during its decades-long flight, which galactic milestones have been recorded in the process and what the future of the venerable space vehicle looks like.
Subscribe for more! â–º https://bit.ly/2Q64mGd
Credit: NASA, ESA, ESO, SpaceX, Wikipedia, Shutterstock, ...
#TheSimplySpaceEN
item.itunes:subtitle: by TheSimplySpace published on Thursday, July 8 2021 at 14:00:00

item.title: Especial anÃ¡lisis situaciÃ³n actual, con el Dr. Rafael Toledo - Radio El Respeto
item.description:
Rafael Toledo es CatedrÃ¡tico de ParasitologÃ­a y profesor de InmunologÃ­a en la Universitat de ValÃ¨ncia (UV). Durante el programa analizamos la situaciÃ³n actual de la pandemia en EspaÃ±a, cubriendo temas como la subida de contagios, papel de la variante Delta, si este incremento de casos estÃ¡ impactando a nivel ingresos y fallecidos, inmunidad de grupo y vacunas.
El Dr. Toledo expone tambiÃ©n su visiÃ³n sobre las medidas que adoptÃ³ EspaÃ±a durante el confinamiento, la estrategia de vacunaciÃ³n y lo que podemos esperar en el futuro prÃ³ximo. ____________________________________________________________________________________________

item.title: Vacunas y ADE - Radio El Respeto
item.description:
El ADE es un fenÃ³meno que consiste en que los anticuerpos, en vez de combatir al virus, facilitan la infecciÃ³n y agravan la enfermedad. Algo asÃ­ como si se aliaran con Ã©l. Es muy inusual, perose ha observado con el dengue y con el zika, con una de las candidatas a vacuna contra el VRS y el sarampiÃ³n, pero siempre de detectÃ³ en los ensayos y se retiraron. En coronavirus anteriores se vio que si se usaba la proteÃ­na N, la vacuna era mÃ¡s propensa a provocar ADE, y esa es una de las razones por las que ahora se utiliza la proteÃ­na S. Gracias a eso, precisamente, toda esa informaciÃ³n de esos coronavirus anteriores se ha utilizado en el desarrollo de estas vacunas. Se han puesto mil millones de dosis de vacunas en el mundo, y no se ha visto nada.
Esta es la opiniÃ³n del Dr. Pepe AlcamÃ­ y del Dr. Luis Enjuanes (extractos de las entrevistas mantenida con ellos en el canal).
____________________________________________________________________________________________

item.title: Entrevista completa: "El Bill Gates espaÃ±ol" #LaEstirpedelosLibres - Canal Iker JimÃ©nez
item.description:
JosÃ© Luis DomÃ­nguezÂ es probablemente el hombre que mÃ¡s contribuyÃ³ a la implantaciÃ³n masiva de los ordenadores domÃ©sticos en EspaÃ±a. Fue el fundador de la empresaÂ IndescompÂ y el autÃ©ntico introductor de la marcaÂ AmstradÂ en nuestro paÃ­s. A principios de los ochenta abandonÃ³ su trabajo como agente de seguros con la intenciÃ³n de vender microordenadores. Fue el fundador de Indescomp, una leyenda en la historia del software espaÃ±ol gracias a los juegosÂ 'La pulga'Â yÂ 'Fred'.
Gracias al ordenador CPC 464 de la empresa Amstrad marcÃ³ un hito en la historia de la informÃ¡tica casera espaÃ±ola. En Indescomp, a principios de los aÃ±os 80 y bajo su batuta, se juntaron algunos de los mejores desarrolladores espaÃ±oles. Casi todos los videojuegos que Indescomp desarrollÃ³ para Amstrad CPC fueron publicados bajo el sello de Amsoft, una subsidiaria de Amstrad. Desde 1985 hasta 1989 Indescomp publicÃ³, bajo el nombre de Amstrad User, una revista dedicada exclusivamente a los usuarios de Amstrad en EspaÃ±a.
item.itunes:subtitle: by Canal Iker JimÃ©nez published on Tuesday, June 8 2021 at 22:26:50

The 2020 MTV EMAs are hosted by Little Mix and feature performances from Jack Harlow, Alicia Keys, Tate McRae, DaBaby, Karol G, David Guetta, Sam Smith, Maluma, Doja Cat, YUNGBLUD, Zara Larsson, Little Mix, Madison Beer, Why Don't We, and 24kGoldn.

item.title: CS50 Lecture by Mark Zuckerberg - 7 December 2005
item.description:
On 7 December 2005, Mark Zuckerberg joined CS50 for a guest lecture about Facebook and computer science. With Professor Michael D. Smith. Shared with permission.
***
HOW TO SUBSCRIBE
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=cs50tv
HOW TO TAKE CS50
edX: https://cs50.edx.org/ Harvard Extension School: https://cs50.harvard.edu/extension Harvard Summer School: https://cs50.harvard.edu/summer OpenCourseWare: https://cs50.harvard.edu/x
